dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3664 IH: To prohibit the availability of Federal funds to the World Health Organization pending the conduct of an investigation relating to the influence over such organization by Chinese Communist Party, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Santos introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit the availability of Federal funds to the World Health Organization pending the conduct of an investigation relating to the influence over such organization by Chinese Communist Party, and for other purposes.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding to World Health Organization pending investigation

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, no Federal funds may be made available, directly or indirectly, to the World Health Organization until the President—

paragraph.text: conducts an investigation, with the compliance of the Director-General of the World Health Organization, to assess and determine the level of influence by the Chinese Communist Party over the operations of the World Health Organization (including with respect to influence regarding the origin of COVID–19 and any coverup relating to such origin); and
submits to the appropriate congressional recipients a report containing the findings of such investigation.

subsection.text: In this section, the term appropriate congressional recipients means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on the Judiciary and the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives;
the Committee on the Judiciary and the Committee on Finance of the Senate;
the Speaker and minority leader of the House of Representatives; and
the majority leader and minority leader of the Senate.
